newsitem.title: GERMANY: Bayer enters 9th joint-venture in China.
newsitem.headline: Bayer enters 9th joint-venture in China.

text.p: German chemicals giant Bayer AG on Wednesday said it plans to invest $12.5 million in a joint-venture to produce high quality polycarbonate engineering products in China. Bayer said it has reached an agreement to join forces with the Beijing Guangyi Polycarbonate Panel Co. Ltd to form a company called Bayer Buangyi Panel Co. Ltd, where Bayer will hold a 70 percent stake while the Chinese group holds a 30 percent stake.
The new group will develop, produce and market a comprehensive line of polycarbonate products to the domestic building and construction industries, Bayer said in a statement.
This is Bayer's ninth joint-venture in China and the group has invested over $160 million in activities ranging from dyestuffs to health care.
Bayer estimated that by the year 2000 these activities would add an additional $200 million in annual turnover in China, which last year stood at $520 million.
